dt: {bc}to spring up and develop to maturity
{bc}to be able to grow in some place or situation

dt.t: trees that {wi}grow{/wi} in the tropics

dt: {bc}to assume some relation through or as if through a process of natural {a_link|growth}

dt.t: ferns {wi}growing{/wi} from the rocks

dt: {bc}to increase in size by assimilation of material into the living organism or by accretion of material in a non-biological process (such as crystallization)

dt.t: The tree {it}grew{/it} to an immense size.
{wi}grows{/wi} in wisdom
the book {it}grew{/it} out of a series of lectures
{it}grew{/it} pale
habit {wi}grows{/wi} on a person
didn't like it at first, but it {it}grew{/it} on him
{wi}grow{/wi} wheat
{it}grew{/it} a beard
start a business and {wi}grow{/wi} it successfully

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}grōwan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}gruowan{/it} to grow
shortdef: to spring up and develop to maturity
to be able to grow in some place or situation
to assume some relation through or as if through a process of natural growth

dt: {bc}to grow toward or arrive at full stature or physical or mental maturity {bc}to progress from childhood toward adulthood

dt.t: {it}growing up{/it} intellectually
{wi}grew up{/wi} in the city
She wants to be a doctor when she {wi}grows up{/wi}.

dt: {bc}to stop thinking or behaving in a childish way

dt.t: He should {wi}grow up{/wi} and accept his responsibilities.

dt: {bc}to begin to exist and develop as time passes

dt.t: A number of cities {wi}grew up{/wi} along the river.

shortdef: to grow toward or arrive at full stature or physical or mental maturity : to progress from childhood toward adulthood; also : to become an adult
to stop thinking or behaving in a childish way
to begin to exist and develop as time passes

dt: {bc}to become less friendly or emotionally close as time passes {bc}to become distant from someone

dt.t: My wife and I have {it}grown apart{/it} over the years.

shortdef: to become less friendly or emotionally close as time passes : to become distant from someone

dt.t: The company {it}grew from{/it} an idea he had in college.

shortdef: to come from or originate from (something)

dt.t: She has {it}grown into{/it} an accomplished and charming young woman.
His small company has {it}grown into{/it} a huge international corporation.

dt: {bc}to become large enough for (a certain size of clothing)

dt.t: Ben will {it}grow into{/it} Billy's shoes in a year or two.

shortdef: to become large enough for (a certain size of clothing)

dt: {bc}to become more appealing to (someone) as time passes

dt.t: Try the drink again—it {it}grows on{/it} you.
I didn't like him at first, but he's starting to {it}grow on{/it} me.

shortdef: to become more appealing to (someone) as time passes

dt.t: She's {it}growing out{/it} her hair.
